search_term: Find the official pricing page URL for Coda (coda.com). Only provide the exact URL to the pricing page, not a summary of pricing information.
response_text: The official pricing page for Coda is: [https://coda.io/pricing](https://coda.io/pricing) .

extracted_content.content:
FreeProTeamEnterprise

Free

Try for free

Free for you and your team

Pro

Get started

$10/month **per Doc Maker**

$30/month **per Doc Maker**

Let's chat

Custom

Let's chat

Compare plans

Doc size

Building blocks like pages and tables that power your writeups, trackers, hubs, and more contribute to doc size. [Learn more](https://help.coda.io/en/articles/3388778-how-is-doc-size-calculated)

Unlimited for unshared docs

Unlimited

Unlimited

Unlimited

Coda AI

Delegate tasks, rethink content creation, and get insights faster. Manage AI credits for your workspace. [Learn more](https://help.coda.io/en/articles/8411650)

Try for free

Some credits

More credits

Most credits

Automations

Put your repetitive yet important tasks — like sending daily updates — on autopilot. [Learn more](https://help.coda.io/en/articles/2423860-using-automations)

Low quota

Medium quota

Unlimited

Unlimited

Attachments

1GB per doc

5GB per doc

Unlimited

Unlimited

Packs

Packs connect your doc to the apps you use every day. With select Packs, you can sync, edit, and update data from Coda. [Learn more](https://coda.io/packs)

Manual data refresh

FAQsWhat is a "Workspace"?

A workspace is the home for you and your team in Coda. It will store your docs in an organized way, and you can invite Doc Makers and Editors into your workspace to collaborate all in one place. For administrators, this is the place where you'll configure your team's settings and manage your account.

What is a "Doc Maker"?

Doc Makers can create and manage docs, pages, folders, and workspaces.

Specifically — in workspaces, Doc Makers have the power to create new docs and templates and create and manage folders to organize the workspace. Within docs, Doc Makers can administer things like adding pages, changing doc and page titles and icons, adjusting the timezone, configuring doc and page locking etc. Coda AI is also included for Doc Makers.

Editors can edit content and collaborate in existing docs & pages, including adding tables & views, constructing formulas & buttons, adding and configuring Packs & automations, etc. [Learn more](https://help.coda.io/en/articles/3388781-roles-in-coda-doc-makers-admins-and-editors)

Who do I pay for and why?

Upgrading a free workspace to a paid plan can be done with a single Doc Maker or can include your whole team to start. As you grow into Coda, you can invite additional members to become Editors or Doc Makers in your workspace. Editors and Viewers are always free.

At the end of each billing cycle, you will be billed for the workspace based on how many Doc Makers are in the workspace. Any changes to the number of Doc Makers in the workspace mid-cycle are automatically prorated.

How much does Coda AI cost?

Coda AI is included for Doc Makers, and Editors also receive a free trial. Based on your plan and number of Doc Makers, each workspace receives a set of credits each month, that are pooled across all Doc Makers. [Learn more](https://help.coda.io/en/articles/8411650)

What is a credit?

Credits are Coda's way of counting how much AI you use. You could think about credits as fragments of text. 1 credit is approximately 40 characters in English, or 7.5 words. Anytime you use Coda AI, we measure how much content is in the input + the output and convert those into credits. So if you have a huge block of text and ask for a small summary, your number of credits will be based on the large input + small output. If you have a small prompt asking AI to write a long essay, you'll have a small input + large output. And if you have a large input and large output, you'll add those lengths together to get your total credits used for that request.

How can I get more AI credits?

If you have used all of your allotted credits, or would like to access more, you can add more Doc Makers to your workspace, upgrade your plan, or purchase an AI credit add-on. You can purchase 2,000 credits for $2/Doc Maker/Month, 6,000 credits for $6/Doc Maker/month, or unlimited credits for $12/Doc Maker/month (billed monthly). [Learn more](https://help.coda.io/en/articles/8411650)

Can I give edit access to people outside of my workspace?

Yes! Whenever you share a doc with someone outside of your workspace, they will be added as a Guest Editor (though you can turn this ability off if you'd like). Guest Editors can edit content in individual docs shared with them, but cannot add and manage pages, or browse the doc's workspace or folder. Guest Editors are free, just like Editors in your workspace.

All Editors and Viewers in a workspace are free! Viewers can open any shared link to a doc and view and comment on it. Just like Guest Editors, Viewers are also guests and cannot see the full workspace or folder.

What happens when I publicly share my doc?

You can always share a doc to anyone with a link through the sharing feature inside the doc. [Learn more](https://help.coda.io/en/articles/1137949-share-your-doc)

When will I get billed for my workspace?

When you sign up for a new plan, as well as when it renews, you will be billed up front for all the users in your workspace.

Whenever you add a new paid user to your workspace (or upgrade an existing one), we'll prorate them for the remainder of your billing cycle. On the annual plan, you will be charged monthly for these additional membership changes, with prorations applied for the remainder of the billing year. Additionally, you will be charged whenever your bill exceeds $1,000 from adding new members.

Do I get a refund if I remove members from my workspace or cancel my plan?

When you remove members or cancel your plan, we'll apply a prorated credit onto your account you can use for future charges in your workspace.

Do you offer discounts for students, educators, non-profits, or startups?

Yes!

*   Students and educators: We offer several discounts, depending on your needs.
    *   If you're a student, get started [here](https://coda.io/for/students).
    *   If you're an educator, get started [here](https://coda.io/for/educators).
*   Non-profits: Qualifying organizations can receive a 50% discount. Get started [here](https://help.coda.io/en/articles/3517611-students-teachers-and-nonprofits#h_c016f343e2).
*   Startups: Eligible startups can get the Team plan free for 6 months for their workspace. Apply [here](https://coda.io/for/startups).

How does Enterprise pricing work?

You only pay for Doc Makers, even on Enterprise. With increased scalability, security and support, Enterprise plans are a great pick if you're planning to roll out Coda across multiple teams or departments. Coda's pricing scales to fit enterprise teams at every stage and we work with you to find the custom fit for your situation. [Request demo](https://coda.io/contact/sales)

With Maker Billing, you only pay for who makes—not who contributes—so everyone gets a seat at the table. Save money with our unique pricing model.
